comments.body:
Does this work?  By doing `(room && room.jitsiTimeout)` its going to return either true or false right?  If true then: `new Date(true).getTime()` if false: `new Date(currentTime).getTime()`

Same in the other two places.

not really @geekgonecrazy .. javascript returns the value from the last "parameter" and not a boolean of the sentence (like for example, PHP does)..
so:

```
var obj = { foo: 'bar' };
console.log( obj && obj.foo ); // prints bar
```

ah ok.  This is one of those ugly Javascript things :grin:  Usually `( stuff here )` is evaluated and returns a boolean.  All good.  Just tried it.  Apparently if it doesn't return true / false its not treated as a boolean check.  Weird..
